intro: Pultenaea cambagei, commonly known as the golden pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect shrub form. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Pultenaea cambagei is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and semi-arid environments.
